   19: %%
   20: -module(ssl_key_update_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -behaviour(ct_suite).
   23: 
   24: %% Callback functions
   25: -export([all/0,
   26:          groups/0,
   27:          init_per_suite/1,
   28:          end_per_suite/1,
   29:          init_per_group/2,
   30:          end_per_group/2,
   31:          init_per_testcase/2,
   32:          end_per_testcase/2]).
   33: 
   34: %% Testcases
   35: -export([key_update_at_client/0,
   36:          key_update_at_client/1,
   37:          key_update_at_server/0,
   38:          key_update_at_server/1,
   39:          explicit_key_update/0,
   40:          explicit_key_update/1]).
   41: 
   42: -include("ssl_test_lib.hrl").
   43: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   44: -include_lib("ssl/src/ssl_api.hrl").
   45: -include_lib("ssl/src/ssl_connection.hrl").
   46: all() ->
   47:     [{group, 'tlsv1.3'}].
   48: 
   49: groups() ->
   50:     [{'tlsv1.3', [], [{group, transport_socket} | tls_1_3_tests()]},
   51:      {transport_socket, [], tls_1_3_tests()}].
   52: 
   53: tls_1_3_tests() ->
   54:     [key_update_at_client,
   55:      key_update_at_server,
   56:      explicit_key_update].
   57: 
   58: init_per_suite(Config0) ->
   59:     catch application:stop(crypto),
   60:     try application:start(crypto) of
   61:         ok ->
   62:             ssl_test_lib:clean_start(),
   63:             case proplists:get_bool(ecdh, proplists:get_value(public_keys, crypto:supports())) of
   64:                 true ->
   65:                     ssl_test_lib:make_ecdsa_cert(Config0);
   66:                 false ->
   67:                     {skip, "Missing EC crypto support"}
   68:             end
   69:     catch _:_ ->
   70:             {skip, "Crypto did not start"}
   71:     end.
   72: 
   73: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   74:     ssl:stop(),
   75:     application:unload(ssl),
   76:     application:stop(crypto).
   77: 
   78: init_per_group(GroupName, Config) ->
   79:     ssl_test_lib:init_per_group(GroupName, Config).
   80: 
   81: end_per_group(GroupName, Config) ->
   82:   ssl_test_lib:end_per_group(GroupName, Config).
   83: 
   84: init_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
   85:     ssl_test_lib:ct_log_supported_protocol_versions(Config),
   86:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),
   87:     Config.
   88: 
   89: end_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
   90:     Config.
   91: 
   92: 
   93: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   94: %% Test Cases --------------------------------------------------------
   95: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   96: key_update_at_client() ->
   97:     [{doc,"Test option 'key_update_at' between erlang client and erlang server."
   98:       "Client initiating the update."}].
   99: key_update_at_client(Config) ->
  100:     key_update_at(Config, client).
  101: 
  102: key_update_at_server() ->
  103:     [{doc,"Test option 'key_update_at' between erlang client and erlang server."
  104:       "Server initiating the update."}].
  105: key_update_at_server(Config) ->
  106:     key_update_at(Config, server).
  107: 
  108: key_update_at(Config, Role) ->
  109:     Data = "123456789012345",  %% 15 bytes
  110:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server(erlang,
  111:                                        [{options, [{keep_secrets, true},
  112:                                                    {key_update_at, 14}]}],
  113:                                        Config),
  114:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  115:     ClientResult = ssl_test_lib:start_client(erlang,
  116:                                              [return_socket, {port, Port},
  117:                                               {options, [{keep_secrets, true},
  118:                                                          {key_update_at, 14}]}],
  119:                                              Config),
  120:     {Client, ClientSocket} = ClientResult,
  121:     Server ! get_socket,
  122:     ServerSocket = receive
  123:                        {Server, {socket, S}} -> S
  124:                    end,
  125:     Keys0 = get_traffic_secrets(ClientSocket, ServerSocket),
  126:     ?CT_LOG("connected", []),
  127:     {Sender, Receiver} = case Role of
  128:                              client -> {Client, Server};
  129:                              server -> {Server, Client}
  130:                          end,
  131:     %% Sending bytes over limit triggers key update
  132:     ssl_test_lib:send(Sender, Data),
  133:     Data = ssl_test_lib:check_active_receive(Receiver, Data),
  134:     %% TODO check if key has been updated (needs debug logging of secrets)
  135:     ct:sleep(500),
  136:     ?CT_LOG("sent and waited", []),
  137:     Keys1 = get_traffic_secrets(ClientSocket, ServerSocket),
  138:     verify_key_update(Keys0, Keys1),
  139:     %% Test mechanism to prevent infinite loop of key updates
  140:     BigData = binary:copy(<<"1234567890">>, 10),  %% 100 bytes
  141:     ok = ssl_test_lib:send(Sender, BigData),
  142:     ct:sleep(500),
  143:     ?CT_LOG("sent and waited 2", []),
  144:     Keys2 = get_traffic_secrets(ClientSocket, ServerSocket),
  145:     verify_key_update(Keys1, Keys2),
  146:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
  147:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client).
  148: 
  149: get_traffic_secrets(ClientSocket, ServerSocket) ->
  150:     ProcessSocket =
  151:         fun(Socket, Role) ->
  152:                 {ok, [{keylog, KeyLog}]} = ssl:connection_information(Socket, [keylog]),
  153:                 Interesting =
  154:                     fun(S) ->
  155:                             Patterns = ["CLIENT_TRAFFIC_SECRET", "SERVER_TRAFFIC_SECRET"],
  156:                             SearchResults = [string:find(S, P) || P <- Patterns],
  157:                             lists:any(fun(I) -> I /= nomatch end, SearchResults)
  158:                     end,
  159:                 TrafficSecrets = lists:filter(Interesting, KeyLog),
  160:                 Print = fun(Secret) ->
  161:                                 [Name, _A, B] = string:lexemes(Secret, " "),
  162:                                 [Key] = io_lib:format("~s", [B]),
  163:                                 {Name, {Role, Key}}
  164:                         end,
  165:                 [Print(Scr) || Scr <- TrafficSecrets]
  166:         end,
  167:     Secrets = lists:flatten(
  168:                 [ProcessSocket(S, R) ||
  169:                     {S, R} <-
  170:                         [{ClientSocket, client}, {ServerSocket, server}]]),
  171:     P = fun(Direction) ->
  172:                 Vals = proplists:get_all_values(Direction, Secrets),
  173:                 ?CT_LOG("~30s ~10s(c) ~10s(s)",
  174:                      [Direction, proplists:get_value(client, Vals),
  175:                       proplists:get_value(server, Vals)]),
  176:                 {Direction, [proplists:get_value(client, Vals),
  177:                              proplists:get_value(server, Vals)]}
  178:         end,
  179:     [P(Direction) ||
  180:         Direction <-
  181:             ["CLIENT_TRAFFIC_SECRET_0", "SERVER_TRAFFIC_SECRET_0"]].
  182: 
  183: verify_key_update(Keys0, Keys1) ->
  184:     CTS0 = proplists:get_value("CLIENT_TRAFFIC_SECRET_0", Keys0),
  185:     CTS1 = proplists:get_value("CLIENT_TRAFFIC_SECRET_0", Keys1),
  186:     STS0 = proplists:get_value("SERVER_TRAFFIC_SECRET_0", Keys0),
  187:     STS1 = proplists:get_value("SERVER_TRAFFIC_SECRET_0", Keys1),
  188:     CTS = lists:zip(CTS0, CTS1),
  189:     STS = lists:zip(STS0, STS1),
  190:     Pred = fun({A, B}) when A == B ->
  191:                    ct:fail(no_key_update),
  192:                    false;
  193:               (_) ->
  194:                    true
  195:            end,
  196:     [true = lists:all(Pred, X) || X <- [CTS, STS]].
  197: 
  198: explicit_key_update() ->
  199:     [{doc,"Test ssl:update_key/2 between erlang client and erlang server."}].
  200: 
  201: explicit_key_update(Config) ->
  202:     Data = "123456789012345",  %% 15 bytes
  203: 
  204:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server(erlang, [], Config),
  205:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  206: 
  207:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client(erlang, [{port, Port}], Config),
  208:     ssl_test_lib:send_recv_result_active(Client, Server, Data),
  209: 
  210:     ssl_test_lib:update_keys(Client, write),
  211:     ssl_test_lib:update_keys(Client, read_write),
  212:     ssl_test_lib:send_recv_result_active(Client, Server, Data),
  213: 
  214:     ssl_test_lib:update_keys(Server, write),
  215:     ssl_test_lib:update_keys(Server, read_write),
  216:     ssl_test_lib:send_recv_result_active(Client, Server, Data),
  217:     %% TODO check if key has been updated (needs debug logging of secrets)
  218: 
  219:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
  220:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client).
